author: Bryce Wilson
comment: Would like to be able to lengthen the time the watch remains in bright mode. 5 seconds is just too short. Other than that, the watch is near perfect. Add this suggestion and I'll up it to 5-stars! 10/14/16 Update: A year later and we still can't adjust the amount of time the face remains bright. Reducing rating to 3-stars.
title: Awesome face!

author: Thomas K
comment: This is my current favorite watchface by Zuhanden. Of course all of his watchfaces are amazing. I started with Ranger but I have switched to Speeds because I find it even clearer and easier to read. I also like the date indicator. The only thing I don't like is that it's a bit less customizable.
title: Current favorite

author: Stephen Syputa
comment: One pays for what one gets with this watch app - undeniably the best-of-breed. Efficient, functional & Informative SPEEDS cleverly packages most of a smart watch's classical information display into an attractive package while not getting an overcrowded look. Though some (unnecessary) elemental color/shape variables are lacking, the watch's SETTINGS are simple to activate, comprehensive and a pleasure to use.  KUDOS to ZUHANDEN.
title: ♤ Bold ♢ Informative ♤ Attractive ♡

author: Jasen Turnbull
comment: UPDATED 12/5/16: 1 Star because it won't stop asking me to rate it continuously the past year or two even though I have already. Please Stop!Orignal: Great watch and use it as my daily face setting for my 360. Had to take 2 stars off as it was completely relentless in asking for a rating. Seemed like every hour since install it kept asking me to rate it. Not an attractive feature when I   keep looking at my watch notifications and it's always taking up the screen asking me to rate it. Dial it down please...
title: Great watch for moto 360

author: John Khtaria
comment: Would like more hand options, current hands are quite thick and at certain times block widgets. Also center circle that "connects" hands disappears in ambient mode. A white center circle in ambient mode would be great.
title: Awesome, but not perfect

author: Matt Landish
comment: This watch face does everything I want except allow customization of the self-branding that says 'Speeds' and 'Smart Watch Face Company' which unnecessarily clutters the display. I have the pro version and it would be great to remove or customize this text.
title: Great watch face, would be perfect if more customizations were offered.

author: Greg Jones
comment: Live that I can display different things, I do weather, date and battery life.  Only problem is that the notifications make it hard to tell the time.  Digital faces don't have that problem but also don't look as good.
title: Very nice

author: Justin Zubko
comment: Really good watch face some issues I love the look of this watch works great does use a lot of battery. And is using a lot of processing power sometimes watch face is very slow and glitches. Really annoying always asking to rate even after I already did
title: Would have got more stars

author: Kevin Jones
comment: My car speedometer broke so I use this to check my speed while driving. The watchface MPH doesn't seem to work correctly, but the app works very well.
title: Very useful

author: Davis Rana
comment: Everytime watch looses battery and reboots, this watch face resets. Why doesn't it maintain the settings?              When it works, its great. But for each reboot, I have to reconfigure the watch face.
title: Watch face consistently resets and looses settings

author: Bob Marsh
comment: Use this face all the time.  Edit, while I still love the app I REALLY hate the constant messages I get asking me if I like the watchface. I reviewed it favourably when I installed it on my old phone. Since installing it on the new phone I get asked at least once a day if I like it. Well that's cost you four stars as I hate being pestered. If it continues I'll delete the app and find another. Please dont spoil a great app by pestering the users.

author: Ed Krause
comment: Very annoying I'm constantly being harassed to rate this watch face. It's great watch face but being forced to rate it, is ridiculous.
title: Being forced to rate something I paid for

author: Joel Tijerina
comment: I like the different features you can have showing. Only thing is I wish the hands could get a little thinner. Besides that it's a good buy!

author: Dave Allison
comment: Looks wonderful, but since my LG G watch does not have an integrated GPS, I was hoping that the watch would default to the GPS on my phone as the data source.  Is this possible in a future version?  EDIT: Why then is it always only displaying '6' under speed? Even when I'm sitting in my chair...  UPDATE: Why does this watch face insist on asking me every couple days if I like it? Haven't I said no enough? Dropping to 3 stars until they turn off the spammy behavior

reply.author: Zuhanden
reply.content: Hi Dave, we are using the GPS of your phone so it should still work. Please be aware that GPS might drain quite some battery. Best, Hans

author: West Bridgford
comment: If you hadn't kept bugging me I would have rated it highly but you just can't let go...
title: They keep bugging for a rating

author: Matthew Dvorak
comment: I like the software but please stop harassing me to rate it please. I already switched to paid version. I think that should say enough.
title: Nice watch face.

author: Ketzal Sterling
comment: Highly annoying notification asking me to rate it. Get ride of that  pointless prompt and I'll go five stars.
title: Idiotic notification to get me to rate it

author: Tofu88
comment: One of the best looking imo. Would be 5 star of we had the option to change ambient light as it's still pretty bright right now. It also seems to record it's own 'steps' rather than syncing with the watch's step counter.
title: Almost there!

author: Adam Bennett
comment: Awesome. Think there's a big tho because it keeps asking if I like the watch face and keeps pestering for a review

author: Eric Suire
comment: Wish I could show my device battery phone battery AND the date all at once. Sorry to be picky. I do love the watch.
title: Love it.

author: Andrew Holstrom
comment: Looks great, weather isn't accurate most of the time, but that's not a deal breaker in my eyes.
title: Great watch face

author: Tony Zoccolillo
comment: I don't want to be constantly asked how I like this watch face especially after I already rated it.  How about 1 notification and that's it!!!! I did give this a 5* but I'm taking a * off every time I get this notification.

author: Robert Miller
comment: Paid for the app, but constantly begging for a rating? Here you go, then.
title: Nag

author: Jude Thomas
comment: Aside from the fact that this watch face is difficult to read when the screen is dim, I'm really bothered that it keeps nagging me to review it, especially considering that it wasn't free.
title: Nag notification on a paid app is poor form

author: Benjamin Alvis Hermann
comment: Great looking watch face. Not sure how the speedometer works (maybe your watch needs GSP?), and don't like the way notifications look in low power mode. Otherwise this has become my default watch face.
title: Looks great!

author: Roger Eastvold
comment: Needs a speed dial for cycling. 0 to 40? Better resolution. A speedometer for a car or high-speed vehicle is redundant

author: Greg Martin
comment: The look is clean and classic, however the weather information is off by a good 10 degrees. Please add in the option to select a different weather provider as you have in the "Odyssey" watch face, or update the current one to be more accurate.

author: Seza Tas
comment: Please add more color options in settings. There are just a few colors and not enough for personalization.
title: Nice but needs more

author: luc wastiaux
comment: I love this clear and legible watch face, which is very good looking. I would love it if there were more hour numbers, such as 3, 6, 9 in order to facilitate reading of the hours hand.
title: Very clean design

author: Ronnie Sikh
comment: Great work buddy. Just a suggestion, for the speeds app, it would be great if it could log the fastest and average speed, along with the real time speed. ;) other than that, good job!
title: Epic watch face!

author: Alan Moodie
comment: The watch face is stylish, but would benefit from a few more options to personalise like being to set the display time between 5 and 20 seconds.
title: Good, but could be great

author: David Xenakis
comment: This face looks far more professional and realistic than any other face I've seen. I like the display options very much, and recommend it to anyone.
title: Beautiful, classic watch face!

author: Mert Kece
comment: It simply looks wonderful! Definitely my favourite watch face  though it would be nice if there was even more customisation options.
title: Very Attractive Watchface

author: Paul Rhodes
comment: Very good design. Would like to be able to remove the speeds branding as it just adds clutter.
title: Very good watch face

author: Kevin Swanson
comment: I love the way this looks.  I wish it had all the customization options the Ranger face has, which I also bought.  Would like to be able to set brightness of ambient mode, like I can with Ranger.
title: Nice looking

author: Bob Levkulic
comment: Great watchface, but only giving 4 star as speed/temp remains hidden by notifications,especially when navigating. Swap this with your logo on top for a superior watch.

author: Ronan Lavelle
comment: Very stylish.  Only issue is that the battery reading does not always tally up with the watch's reading.
title: Everyone comments on this watch face

author: Andrew Kajda
comment: Nice Face, good settings interface, fitness & weather interface, though there should be access the top quadrant & customization options.
title: Motorola Moto X Pure 140 GB

author: Frederik MHz
comment: Yeah, weather addon showing 22C and it's like 33C atleast it was right about being clear... Rest seems good for now
title: It's good and all works, but the weather addon

author: Steve Hewett
comment: A very simple and attractive design. I appreciate the weather.  Good battery life.
title: All that I need
